intro: Orthocarpus tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leaf orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its small, white or greenish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, contributing to its common name.
